page.title: 01Emborough Parish & District
page.content: The small village of Emborough lies on the northern edge of the mendip Hills on a limestone plateau, some 700 feet above sea level. The soil supports mainly grass crops and grazing for cattle. As well as the parish of Emborough, our area also includes parts of the parishes of Binegar, Cheton Mendip, Chilcompton and Ston Easton. It is dissected by two main roads, the A37 and the B3139 which cross at Old down. There has been some stone quarrying in the area in the past although this is now abandoned. The course of the Old Somerset & Dorset railway can still be traced in places. This mainly agricultural area is drained by several small streams which feed the rivers Somer and Frome. There is one fair-sized lake, Emborough pond, which provides local fishing.
